text:
- Our first experience on
Lambda, so let me check.
- Let me see.

Just trying to think of, I
mean, I've built so many.
I'm just trying to think of,
what one would be really interesting?

- Well, I think Farrah
wanted me to show my tattoo,
because I have a Lambda tattoo. (laughs)
- [Interviewer] Oh, really? You do?
- Let me try that one more time.
- Let's see here.
- Oh, oh, oh, oh, right, right, right.
- When I discovered Lambda in 2015,

the way that I saw how you
would build apps with that
completely changed the way I thought
about building applications.

- I remember when Lambda
first was launched,

and it was kind of this
thumbnailing service for S3,
and then as time sorta went on,
more and more people were like,
"Well, this is really useful.
Could we apply this to something new?"

- What really surprised me
and was absolutely gratifying

was how quickly bigger
organizations and enterprises
quickly took to Lambda and said,

"This is perfect for
so many different kinds
of applications that we're building,

from stream-based processing
and data processing

to changing formats to building
internal applications."
(upbeat music)

- It's allowed me to focus
on things that matter

to my customers and allow me
to be far more productive.
- I've worked mostly with smaller teams.

Lambda and ECS both have
been really instrumental

in us being able to keep
our infrastructure part
in infrastructure as code.

- When I use AWS Lambda, we
can keep our team smaller.

- Lambda's also helped us to
have almost 100% of uptime
without having a dedicated ops team.

- Lambda has been
critical to most projects
that I've been involved in.

It allows you to run code
without managing servers,
without having to deal with the scaling
to support your traffic, both up and down,

and remove so many tasks
from your to-do list.

- When you're working
with Lambda functions,

for scalability perspective,
it's been amazing,

and since Lambda's cost
is on per execution,
it's very cost-effective.

- One of the biggest
benefits of building anything
on Lambda and serverless services at AWS

is the fact that my team
can move ridiculously fast.
- Serverless is the actually key concept
and key at the hundred that we are using
to actually speed up the delivery cycles,
speed up the delivery of business value,

and help science actually
move a lot faster
than it was doing before serverless.

- When you're working with
a team on a real product
that real people use and depend on,

it's really great to have
both the power of ECS
and the power of Lambda to back us up.

- The more I'm thinking
about it, it's like,
well, did I ever do anything
without having a Lambda function?
- Yeah, I think Lambda and ECS
really offered a simplified way for teams
to take their ideas to market.
- I can't resist sharing this segment

from the blog post I wrote 10
years ago to launch Lambda.

"Lambda is a zero-administration
compute platform.
You don't have to configure, launch,
or monitor EC2 instances.

You don't have to install
any operating systems
or language environments.

You don't need to think about
scale or fault tolerance,

and you don't need to
request a reserve capacity.

A freshly-created
function is ready and able

to handle tens of thousands
of requests per hour

with absolutely no incremental
effort on your part
and on a very cost-effective basis."

Totally true a decade
ago, and still true today.
(upbeat music)
- Happy birthday, Lambda and ECS.
- Happy birthday, you two kids,
and here's to 10 more years of greatness.
- Here's to many more years

of taking undifferentiated
heavy lifting off of customers.
- Thanks for making me more productive
for the last 10 years.
- I'm shocked Lambda's 10 now.

I don't know where the time
went. That happened so fast.
Yeah, happy birthday, Lambda.
I hope we get another 100 years of you.

- Happy a decade, my old
friend, Lambda function.

- So happy birthday to,
yes, Lambda and also ECS,
but I have to say thanks to Lambda

for really changing my
life, my career trajectory,

and providing me with friends
from all over the world,

and for helping me to see
so many people excelling

and feeling like they're
accomplishing more in less time.
